Clinical Laboratory Standards Institute is a US based implementing partner mandated to reach out to the KMLTTB and support in the implementation of the validation of in vitro diagnostic devices and reagents. This mechanism also aims at supporting implementation of WHO-AFRO SLIPTA activities that will lead to accreditation of MOH laboratories nationally.
Strategies for cost-efficiency include: re Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. objectives

Clinical Laboratory Standards Institute is a US based implementing partner mandated to reach out to the KMLTTB and support in the implementation of the validation of in vitro diagnostic devices and reagents. This mechanism also aims at supporting implementation of WHO-AFRO SLIPTA activities that will lead to accreditation of MOH laboratories nationally.
Strategies for cost-efficiency include: regular business system analysis, expenditure analysis and adopting harmonization of trainings and on site embedded mentorship strategies any other programmatic cost-efficient strategies will be given priority.
CLSI is supporting MOH facilities and the lab regulatory body and building the capacity of local staff and these institutions in view of country ownership and self-sustainability at program expiration
In support of one monitoring and evaluation (M&E) system, the program will periodically monitor and report on key laboratory program indicators, such as number of accredited laboratories , number of labs undergoing accreditation, and number of lab personnel trained.
